qas.question: What is on each side of a thoracic segment?
How many ganglia are on each side of a thoracic segment?
Ganglia are connected into a what?
How many pairs of ganglia are in a segment?
What other location on an insect are ganglia located?

context: The thoracic segments have <a1_0>one<a1_0/> <a0_0>ganglion<a0_0/> on each side, which are connected into <a2_0>a pair<a2_0/>, <a3_0>one pair<a3_0/> per segment. This arrangement is also seen in the <a4_0>abdomen<a4_0/> but only in the first eight segments. Many species of insects have reduced numbers of ganglia due to fusion or reduction. Some cockroaches have just six ganglia in the abdomen, whereas the wasp Vespa crabro has only two in the thorax and three in the abdomen. Some insects, like the house fly Musca domestica, have all the body ganglia fused into a single large thoracic ganglion.
